revised_title: Spectroscopic Analysis of the Bessemer Process and High Temperature Flames
tldr: This article investigates the flame spectra of the Bessemer process, focusing on the spectroscopic phenomena and thermo-chemistry involved. The author examines the complex spectrum, which includes lines of carbon monoxide, manganese, and iron, as well as the alkali metals sodium, potassium, and lithium. The study provides a detailed analysis of the spectrum's constitution during different stages of the "blow" and explains the factors affecting its appearance and disappearance.
